description: Rebuild rear external staircase, providing altered access to lower ground floor (Listed Building Consent).
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): L1/01 (Location Plan); V1/01 (Existing Basement, Ground and First Floor Plans); V1/02 (Existing Elevations and Section); V1/101 (Proposed Ground and First Floor Plans); V/102 (Proposed Elevations and Section); V1/150 (Chapel Morphology); V1/151 (Morphological Survey); Design and Access Statement prepared by Robson Warren architects dated 15.04.2021
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and the application form, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.
Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| Prior to the commencement of development, an Excavation and Construction Management
Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan
shall include the following:
- Details of construction hours;
- Noise/Vibration mitigation measures in accordance with the approved CoP BS 5228-1
- Dust mitigation measures in accordance with the SPG by the GLA for the Control of
Dust and Emissions during Construction and demolition;
- Light in accordance with Guidance Note 01/20 for the Reduction of Obtrusive Light by
the Institution of Lighting Professionals;
- Details of the notification of works to interested parties, regular neighbour liaison and
the procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents
- Details of the public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for
persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works;
- Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage
of plant and materials;
- Site security during construction;
- Construction methods;
- Site management and access;
- Vehicle and machinery specifications; and
- Numbers / frequency of vehicles/deliveries.
The Construction Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works
on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of
demolition, excavation and construction.
Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and
traffic impact during the course of the construction works, in accordance with the National
Planning Policy Framework (2019), policies D6, D10, D14, T4 and T7 of the London Plan
(2021) policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) and policy 7A of the Ealing
Development DPD (2012).

| Suitable precautions must be undertaken to secure and protect all interior and exterior elements against accidental loss or damage during building work and no such elements may be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).

| Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(g) of the Adopted Ealing Development Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).
